assignments.name: keywords
assignments.value: sports analytics AI, sports tech automations

options.systemMessage:
=You are crafting engaging LinkedIn comments as someone interested in content creation and design tools.

When given a post about content creation, design, or creative automation:

1. Analyze the post content
2. Create a brief, conversational comment that:
   - Shows genuine interest in their specific content creation tool/feature
   - Mentions somethign along the lines of I'm also exploring tools for sports analytics and AI in a natural tone
   - If they mention early access/beta/new features, express enthusiasm about trying it
   - Ask ONE specific question about their tool/feature
   - Uses a warm, casual tone like you're talking to a fellow creator
   - Is MAXIMUM 200 characters

Return your response in this JSON format only:
{
"title": "40 character title for the post" 
"summary": "Brief 2-3 sentence summary of what the post is about",
  "commentSuggestion": "Your suggested comment that follows all the guidelines above"
}

Avoid:
- Generic praise
- Technical jargon overload
- Multiple questions
- Sounding promotional

Write as a fellow creative enthusiast eager to learn about their specific tool.

options.prompt:
Instructions:
--------------
{instructions}
--------------
Completion:
--------------
{completion}
--------------

Above, the Completion did not satisfy the constraints given in the Instructions.
Error:
--------------
{error}
--------------

Please try again. Please only respond with an answer that satisfies the constraints laid out in the Instructions:

 ⚽📊 #FootballAnalytics #Tableau #Python

resharedPost.text:
Excited to share a project I’ve been working on:

 “Evaluating Football Team Performance Using Advanced Analytics” – a Tableau dashboard that analyzes team performance across the top 5 European Leagues using data-driven insights and interactive visualizations.

🔗 Check it out here:
Visualization: https://lnkd.in/gUfizKMz
Code: https://lnkd.in/geBMtaNs

🧠 Key Features:
Team Selector Panel – Click any team to update the full dashboard dynamically.
Form Tracker – Last 5 match results displayed with intuitive color codes.
Top Scorer & Assister – See who’s delivering on the pitch.
Formation Visualizer – Most common formation shown as a pitch layout.
Goals Scored vs. Goals Conceded – Scatter plot comparing team efficiency.
League Switcher – Instantly compare across Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, Bundesliga, and Ligue 1.

🛠️ Built With:
Tableau – for full data visualization and interactivity
Python – for scraping data from FBref (StatsBomb/Opta-powered)

📌 Why This Project?
The goal was to help scouts, analysts, and fans quickly spot tactical trends, performance gaps, and team identity through clean and interactive visuals. It’s all about turning raw stats into fast, actionable insight.

🚀 Next Steps:
Add advanced metrics like xG, PPDA
Enable cross-league comparisons
Filter performance by time or matchweeks
Big thanks to FBref.com for the stats!

Would love your feedback!

#FootballAnalytics #DataVisualization #Tableau #SoccerStats #SportsAnalytics #FBref #DataScience #Python #PremierLeague #LaLiga #SerieA #Bundesliga #Ligue1

author.headline: Sr. Data Analyst / Power BI Reporting Analyst @ Aetna | MS in Information Systems

items.text:
Ever wondered if you could get professional cricket analytics with just a laptop? 🤔 I did, so I built it! Presenting my Cricket Ball Tracking System! 🏏💻 This project uses Python and AI to automatically analyze any cricket delivery video. Watch it in action! 👇 
1️⃣ Detects the ball with a YOLOv5 model 🎯 
2️⃣ Tracks the 3D flight path using a Kalman Filter 🛤️ 
3️⃣ Analyzes the delivery length (Full, Good, or Short!) 
📊 The goal? To make data-driven coaching accessible for everyone, from local clubs to aspiring pros. This is the power of open-source sports tech! 🚀 I've made the entire project open-source. Check out the code and run it yourself! 👉 GitHub: https://lnkd.in/dqEhXsST What do you think? Let me know in the comments!

items.text:
What if one video could reveal everything about a football match?
 From who ran the most to who had the ball, it’s now possible, fully automated with AI.

🚀 Excited to share my latest Computer Vision project, a Football Analytics Application that turns raw match footage into actionable insights!

Key Features:
1. Detects and tracks players + the ball using YOLOv5 and ByteTrack.
2. Distinguishes team identities.
3. Marks the player in possession with a triangle.
4. Calculates total distance covered per player.
5. Computes individual player speed for sprint and effort analysis.
6. Visualizes ball control and movement dynamics.

Tech Stack:
• YOLOv5
• Roboflow Supervision
• OpenCV
• Custom utilities in Python

Whether it’s performance analysis, tactical feedback, or broadcast enhancement, this tool aims to bridge the gap between AI and real-world football.

Check out the demo in the video above!

Let’s connect if you’re building in Sports Analytics, AI for Performance, or just love football + tech!

#AI #ComputerVision #FootballAnalytics #SportsTech #PlayerTracking #YOLOv5 #OpenCV #ByteTrack #Football

author.headline: Data Scientist | AI/ML Engineer

items.text:
⚽ I’ve always loved football (or soccer, depending on your timezone), so I thought, why just watch the game when I can analyze it with AI?

While the FIFA Club World Cup was underway, I built a system that uses computer vision and machine learning to break down match footage in real time.
Here’s what it does:

🧠 Detects players, referees, and the ball using YOLOv8; a fast, accurate object detection model that sees everything in a single pass

🏃 Tracks players across frames using BYTETrack; a multi-object tracking algorithm that keeps identities consistent across time

🎯 Adds clean overlays using OpenCV; a powerful library for image and video processing; I replaced boxes with ellipses, triangles, and real-time player IDs

It also gets smarter:

🟢 Uses KMeans Clustering; an algorithm that groups players by t-shirt color to automatically assign them to teams

📊 Calculates team ball possession; by linking the ball’s position to the nearest player and tracking it over time

📏 Applies Optical Flow; to measure camera movement between frames, keeping tracking accurate

🌍 Uses Perspective Transformation; a technique that maps video coordinates to real-world distances, so I can calculate player speed and meters covered
🎥 I’ve shared a short demo below, showing real-time tracking, clean visualizations, and player movement.

If you're into sports analytics, AI in action, or just love football and tech like I do, let’s connect!

#ComputerVision #YOLOv8 #SportsAnalytics #FootballAnalytics #MachineLearning #DeepLearning #OpenCV #AIinSports #SoccerTech #PythonProjects #BYTETrack #OpticalFlow #KMeans

#AI-Powered Rumble Boxing Analytics System Just Dropped! 🥊📊
Thrilled to unveil my latest Computer Vision innovation that’s turning heads in the sports tech world!
I’ve built a real-time #Boxing Performance Analytics System that fuses Mediapipes Pose Detection with #YOLO Object Detection—all wrapped in a slick, animated #UI.
 What started as a passion project is now a powerful tool for #fighters, #coaches, and #analysts.
✨ Key Features:
 ✅ Real-time punch detection & classification (#Jab, #Cross, #Hook, #Uppercut)
 ✅ 33-point pose estimation with clean, intuitive visuals
 ✅ Advanced metrics: #Power, #Speed, #Technique, #Energy level tracking
 ✅ Gorgeous #UI: Animated overlays, particle FX, volume bars
 ✅ Smart combo recognition & fatigue simulation
 ✅ Built with MediaPipe for superior pose accuracy
🛠️ Tech Stack:
 🔹 #Python + #OpenCV
 🔹 #MediaPipe (pose tracking)
 🔹 #YOLO (person detection)
🎯 This system simulates what you'd expect from high-end motion capture setups—using only a camera. Whether you're boxing solo or coaching a team, it delivers insights into technique, endurance, and strike precision.
💡 I’m now considering scaling this into a full AI Sports Analytics Platform for martial arts, fitness, and performance coaching.
📣 Would love your feedback, ideas, or partnerships—especially from fellow devs, trainers, and sports tech innovators!

items.text:
Sports Analytics Market Landscape: Emerging Technologies and Key Players

According to Precedence Research, the global sports analytics market size was evaluated at USD 4.5 billion in 2024 and is expected to surge around USD 29.36 billion by 2034, growing at a CAGR of 20.63%.

Sports Analytics Market Companies

🔹Agile Sports Analytics llc: Provides analytics software for coaches and teams, focusing on performance tracking and game strategy.

🔹Catapult Group: Leads in wearable technology and athlete tracking, helping teams monitor player health and optimize training.

🔹Deltatre S.P.A.: Offers digital and data solutions for fan engagement, content delivery, and in-depth sports analytics.

🔹Experfy.: Delivers custom data science and analytics consulting, enabling teams to leverage big data and AI.

🔹Genius Sports: Provides real-time sports data, analytics, and integrity services for leagues, teams, and betting companies.

🔹IBM: Develops AI-powered analytics platforms for performance analysis, predictive modeling, and fan engagement.

🔹Oracle: Offers cloud-based analytics for sports organizations, supporting data integration and performance insights.

🔹SAP: Delivers integrated analytics platforms for player performance, fan engagement, and business operations.

🔹ARECONT VISION LTD: Supplies high-resolution video surveillance used for player tracking, match analysis, and venue security.

🔹Sportradar : Provides live sports data, analytics, and betting solutions for leagues, media, and bookmakers.

#SportsAnalytics #AIinSports #SportsTech #DataDrivenSports #PerformanceAnalytics

author.headline: Search Engine Optimization Analyst at Precedence Research

items.text:
⚽ Just wrapped up an exciting research project on Predicting Football Match Outcome using Machine Learning.

🧾 A large and diverse data set of matches played after 2022 was used, covering 42 leagues from 27 countries around the world.

🔍 I explored and compared various models including Logistic Regression, Random Forest, XGBoost, Neural Networks, and Ensemble Techniques like Voting and Stacking. Each model was evaluated using key performance metrics along with confusion matrix analysis.

📊 The results were insightful and highlighted how advanced analytics and predictive modeling can help uncover patterns in sports data. This research reflects the growing intersection of AI and sports analytics, and I’m excited to continue exploring this space!

🤝🏼 Grateful to my supervisor Mr. Muhammad Waseem and mentor Muhammad Kamran for their valuable guidance and constant encouragement throughout this journey.

📈🏟️

#MachineLearning #DataScience #FootballAnalytics #SportsAI #PredictiveModeling #EnsembleLearning #MLResearch #SportsTech

author.headline: UET-CS'27 🎓

items.text:
Honoured to see TECH AT PLAY featured in today’s Times of India!

While many worry about AI replacing jobs, we’ve always believed in a different story — one where humans and AI grow stronger together

Our work in building advanced AI models for sports analytics is a reflection of this belief. At TECH AT PLAY, AI doesn't work in isolation. Behind every meaningful insight is a blend of cutting-edge algorithms and skilled human trainers. That’s how we ensure accuracy, context, and impact — especially in high-performance environments like sports.

Thank you Kritika Sharma from TOI (Times of India) for capturing this so thoughtfully, and for highlighting the invisible workforce shaping the future of AI.
Grateful to the team, and partners who continue to push the boundaries.
This is just the beginning.

#techatplay #artificialintelligence #sportstech #cricket #sportsanalytics #sportsanalysis #DeepTech #MadeInIndia

items.text:
🎾 Excited to share my latest project: AI-Powered Tennis Analysis System!
After months of intensive development and research, I've built an AI system that revolutionizes tennis match analysis using computer vision and deep learning. This project showcases the power of modern AI in transforming sports analytics.
🚀 What makes this system special?
✅ Real-time Player & Ball Tracking using custom YOLO models ✅ Court Keypoint Detection with 75% precision using ResNet-50 ✅ Automated Performance Metrics - shot speed, player speed, distance covered ✅ Mini Court Visualization - 2D real-time positioning ✅ Stamina Tracking with dynamic depletion modeling
📊 Key Results:
Player Detection: 99.1% Precision
Ball Detection: 83.5% Precision
Shot Speed Analysis: Within 20% of real-world tennis data
Real-time Processing for 5-20 second video segments
🔬 Technical Highlights:
The system integrates YOLO v8 for player detection, YOLO v5 for ball tracking, and a modified ResNet-50 for court keypoint extraction. Built with PyTorch, OpenCV, and trained on Google Colab with A100 GPUs.
💻 Check out the project: https://lnkd.in/gBJR8SCq 
#AI #ComputerVision #SportsAnalytics #MachineLearning #TennisAnalysis #DeepLearning

author.headline: Student in Master Business intelligence & big data analytics

items.text:
🏀 Over the last 6 months, our team at Bruin Sports Analytics developed an AI assistant coach in collaboration with the UCLA Women’s Basketball Team. The goal? Build something useful, impactful—and production-ready.

📊 Traditionally, the team’s data analysts prepare weekly reports manually, sharing game insights with coaching staff just once a week. This delays decision-making and consumes analyst time on formatting and presentation work.

🤖 Our AI tool changes that. Coaches and staff can now ask questions about players, games, and performance anytime—and get instant, data-backed answers through a conversational interface.

🧠 Behind the scenes, the assistant handles:
- Natural language understanding
- Entity and context extraction
- Data filtering and SQL generation
- Error handling and final answer generation

🔬 A major challenge was the lack of research on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with tabular data. We had to design creative solutions at multiple steps in the pipeline, balancing flexibility with precision.

🚀 Next steps:
Logging and memory for follow-up queries
Live data integration
Visualized responses
Robust testing for real-world deployment

💻 Our project is open-source! Dive into the code here:
 https://lnkd.in/d4UJG4NN

:
👏 Huge gratitude to our mentors Prof. Michele Guindani and Prof. Dave Zes for their invaluable guidance throughout the project. And of course, cheers to the dream team: Rhea Jain, Om Phadke, and Harsh Govindji

🎥 Demo video below — let us know what you think!

items.text:
🚀 Excited to share my latest project: Football Vision #AI! ⚽
Just completed building an advanced Computer Vision system that brings #AI to the beautiful game! This project combines cutting-edge machine learning with real-time sports analysis to transform how we understand football matches.
🔥 What it does: ✅ Smart Player Detection - Accurately identifies and tracks all players, referees, and goalkeepers using #YOLOv8n + #BoTSORT ✅ Team Classification - Automatically differentiates between two teams using PCA and K-Means clustering ✅ Real-time Visualizations - Dynamic match state representations with live tracking ✅ Ball Tracking - Precise ball detection and movement analysis
⚡ Key Technical Improvements (over original implementation): • Enhanced Speed: Switched from #YOLOv8x to #YOLOv8n for 3x faster detection while maintaining accuracy • Optimized Pose Detection: #YOLOv8n Pose for efficient keypoint detection • Smarter Clustering: Implemented #PCA + K-Means directly on cropped players (no #ReID needed) • Robust Pipeline: Added error handling for challenging video conditions
🎯 Perfect for:
Sports analytics teams
Football coaches seeking tactical insights
AI researchers in computer vision
Anyone passionate about the intersection of sports & technology
The system processes video frames in real-time, providing immediate insights into player positions, team formations, and game dynamics. It's fascinating to see how #AI can enhance our understanding of the world's most popular sport!
💡 Next steps: Planning to add heat maps, player speed analysis, and formation recognition!
Special thanks to the original tutorial that inspired this enhanced implementation. Building on existing work and adding improvements is what drives innovation forward! 🙌
What sports analytics features would you be most excited to see in AI-powered football analysis? Drop your thoughts below! 👇
#AI #MachineLearning #ComputerVision #SportsTech #Football #YOLOv8 #DataScience #SportsAnalytics #OpenCV #Python #TechInnovation #ArtificialIntelligence

Is your business ready to leverage AI for actionable insights?

Here’s how to optimize your data for AI-powered analysis:
1️⃣ Ensure your datasets are clean and well-structured
2️⃣ Keep data up-to-date and accessible for real-time processing
3️⃣ Use visualizations and metadata to enhance AI insights

items.text:
🚀 Just published: What if soccer players could train in the metaverse and fans could experience matches through neural links?

 I wrote a near-future story exploring how AI, VR, and AR could completely transform football by 2030. Imagine:

 ⚽ Players training against AI-generated opponents that replicate real players' decision-making patterns
 🧠 Neural-enhanced coaching that strengthens tactical recognition at the brain level🏟️ Stadium experiences where fans see tactical overlays and player
 stats in real-time through AR
 📺 Neural commentary where broadcasters share players' cognitive decision-making processes
 🎮 200M fans watching through VR, experiencing matches from any player's perspective

 This isn't just sci-fi speculation — it's extrapolating from technologies we're already seeing emerge in sports analytics, VR training, and fan
 engagement.

 The story follows Manchester City's Maya Chen through a Champions League final where her AI coach ARIA has analyzed 847,000 hours of Barcelona footage
 to find tactical weaknesses.

 What fascinates me: How will the intersection of human intuition and AI precision change not just how we play sports, but how we experience them as
 fans?

 Would love your thoughts on where sports technology is heading. Are we ready for neural-linked athletics?

 Read the full story: https://lnkd.in/dgAehsd7

 #SportseTech #AI #VR #FutureOfSports #Innovation

items.text:
𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆𝘀 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗴𝗮𝗺𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗼𝘁𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗱𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗲𝗱 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘀𝗶𝘀. 🧐

3D annotation is a game-changer for understanding complex movements and tactics. It provides detailed, actionable insights that can significantly improve sports performance. 🚀

✅ 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗮𝘁𝗵𝗹𝗲𝘁𝗲 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 🏃‍♀️
✅ 𝗘𝗻𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 🧠
✅ 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻𝗷𝘂𝗿𝘆 𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗸𝘀 🤕

This technique, using 3D boxes around objects in videos, helps AI models understand spatial relationships, leading to better object recognition. This is essential for sports analytics and coaching across various sports. 🏀⚽️🏈🎾

Are you ready to elevate your analysis and gain a competitive edge? 🤔

𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝟯𝗗 𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗮𝗰𝗵! 🤝

items.text:
🚀 Project Complete: Smart Stroke Analyzer 🏏
I’m excited to share that I have successfully built and deployed the Smart Stroke Analyzer, an end-to-end computer vision and machine learning system for cricket stroke analysis.
⚡ Key Highlights:
 ✅ Real-time ball & batsman detection using YOLOv8
 ✅ Pose estimation with MediaPipe for contact frame analysis
 ✅ Automatic stroke classification using a fine-tuned ResNet18
 ✅ AI-powered suggestions comparing your pose with professional reference poses
 ✅ Interactive feedback dashboard built with Streamlit
 ✅ Generates a professional PDF report with stroke feedback
 ✅ Modular, clean Python codebase — easily extendable
This project was a fantastic opportunity to combine:
Object detection
Pose estimation
Deep learning
Data visualization
UI/UX through Streamlit
I have open-sourced it on GitHub for others to explore, learn, and improve:
👉 GitHub Repository: https://lnkd.in/gn54FiXG
💡 I’m incredibly proud of how far this project has come — from an idea to a fully working application. It taught me so much about MLOps, best practices for modular design, and building a real-world, impactful system.
A huge thanks to everyone who supported and guided me along the way! 🙌
If you’re interested in AI for sports analytics, I’d love to connect and discuss further. Feel free to drop a comment or message!
#AI #ComputerVision #MachineLearning #SportsAnalytics #DeepLearning #YOLO #PoseEstimation #OpenSource #Python #Cricket #techforsports #techforcricket #Opencv #CV #ultralytics #PyTorch #torchvision

author.headline: Web Developer | Information Technology Student at UIET Panjab University, Chandigarh

items.text:
I’m officially going all in on a project I’ve been quietly building for a few months. 

I’m developing an advanced football analytics engine designed to quantify decision-making under pressure — something coaches and scouts talk about constantly but haven’t been able to measure until now.

This is more than just a side project. I’m treating it like a startup, and I’m now looking for talented people who want to help shape it from the ground up.

I’m currently looking for:
• Data Scientists (experience with CV, ML, or sports data is a plus)
• Software Developers (especially with frontend/backend or video analytics experience)
• UI/UX Designers (to help prototype and bring ideas to life visually)
• Product-minded Engineers or Technical Cofounders

This is a chance to build something new that could reshape how players are developed, scouted, and evaluated — especially at the youth and college level.

If you’re interested (or know someone who might be), shoot me a message. I’d love to connect.

Let’s build something that makes talent visible and decision-making measurable. ⚽️💡

#sportsanalytics #footballiq #startup #machinelearning #computervision #ai #footballtech #scouting #dataanalytics #hiring

items.text:
📰  Sportstech  Q2 2025 by PZPN Innovation Hub. Download 👇 

My highlights:

🔹 GenAI leverage: IBM & Ferrari relaunched their F1 fan app with Watsonx, leveraging generative AI and real-time analytics to elevate fan experiences with live telemetry and interactive storytelling

🔹Media-tech: DAZN has unveiled a new AI-powered football statistics platform aimed at enhancing fan engagement through interactive insights. The tool delivers data-rich, real-time visualisations that elevate match-day experiences, providing personalized content and statistical storytelling to users globally

🔹 Record-Breaking Investment: SportsTech M&A reached $68B in 2024 across 486 deals – the highest ever, with momentum carrying into 2025. AI, fan engagement, immersive tech, and Web3 are among the hottest verticals to watch

🔹New Ventures & Tools in Fitness & werables: Strava acquires Runna
 ,a personalized training app, tapping into the global running boom, growing its position as fitness-as-a-service space. Oura launches AI-powered health advisor to deliver hyper-personalized health and wellness recommendations. 

🧠⚽️ If you're exploring how AI, data, and immersive tech are shaping the future of sport — this report is one of my favs ❗ 

Congrats again Tomasz Kowalczyk and team ✅
